extendedIngredients.name: chiles
extendedIngredients.originalString: 8 Hatch green chiles, roasted, skins and seeds removed, divided

recipes.title: Creamy Hatch Green Chile Dip

winePairing.pairingText: Cava, Grenache, and Shiraz are my top picks for Chili. These juicy reds don't have too much tannin (important for spicy foods), but a sparkling wine like cava can tame the heat even better. One wine you could try is Bohigas Brut Reserva Cava. It has 4.3 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 17 dollars.

productMatches.title: Bohigas Brut Reserva Cava
productMatches.description: Pale yellow colour. Constant and small bubble. Foam of great persistence. Very fruity aromas, especially of white fruit (acid apple and pear) on shades of peel of citrics and white flowers. In the background, some spicy notes owed to ageing (cinnamon) and cookies. It is a well-structured "cava" in the mouth. Well picked up over its acidity that tenses it overall from beginning to end. The bubble lends a creamy feeling, and it gives volume and softness to the structure that returns acidity and widens the aromas of white fruits and spices that are repeated in the mouth. Its balanced end harmonizes its acidity, and leaves a memory of freshness and volume owing to its light sugar content

recipes.instructions: Place the cream cheese in a food processor and process until smooth. Add the sour cream and pulse to combine.Roughly chop 6 of the chiles and add them to the processor along with the cumin, onion powder and garlic powder. Process until smooth. Transfer the dip to a bowl.Chop the remaining 2 chiles. Stir into the dip. Taste, and add salt and pepper as needed.Refrigerate the dip until ready to serve. Serve with tortilla chips.

steps.step: Place the cream cheese in a food processor and process until smooth.
Add the sour cream and pulse to combine.Roughly chop 6 of the chiles and add them to the processor along with the cumin, onion powder and garlic powder. Process until smooth.
Transfer the dip to a bowl.Chop the remaining 2 chiles. Stir into the dip. Taste, and add salt and pepper as needed.Refrigerate the dip until ready to serve.
